channel.title: Microsoft 365 Platform Community Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Microsoft 365 Platform Community Blog

item.title: Get started with planning your Power Apps components properly
item.description: Power Apps components are awesome, still I do not see too many organization using them, which is why I want to give some guidance on how to better plan and build components.
Power Apps components are awesome, still I do not see too many organization using them, which is why I want to give some guidance on how to better plan and build components.

item.title: Microsoft 365 PnP Weekly - Episode 174
item.description: Oslo based Power Platform Architect and MVP at Avanade - Ahmad Najjar, joins Microsoftâ€™s Vesa Juvonen and Waldek Mastykarz to discuss evolution, need, connectors, and key wave 2 release features of Power Platform, plus latest 28 articles/videos from Microsoft/Community this week.

item.title: CLI for Microsoft 365 - how cool is that? - Tips and tricks
item.description: CLI for Microsoft 365 is a cross platform command line tool based on Node.js that helps you manage many things around Microsoft 365 and your SPFx project (yes, that as well ðŸ¤©. rename, upgrade … you name it). You may manage OneDrive, Planner, Power Apps and Automate, Teams, Yammer, SharePoint (of course). The list keeps on growing and growing. Lets check some tips and tricks which may improve your experience with CLI for Microsoft 365.

item.title: Run Azure DevOps Pipelines by uninvited users to projects from Power Platform
item.description: Run Azure DevOps Pipelines by uninvited users to projects from Power Platform We will make use of Premium connectors (Azure DevOps, when a HTTP request is received, HTTP) and the standard Excel for Business and Microsoft Team connectors.

item.title: How to Display Data from Multiple SharePoint Lists using PnPjs and DataTables
item.description: In this article, we will learn how to use PnPjs to get data from multiple SharePoint lists and display the collected data in a jQuery Datatables in SharePoint 2013/2016/2019 or online without a SPFx webpart.
